Event.description: Kicking off our very first PAX Australia is Ron Gilbert!
Event.name: Story time with Ron Gilbert

Event.description: Halfbrick, the most successful Australian developer in history, shares stories of their successes such as Fruit Ninja, Jetpack Joyride, and Fish Out Of Water, and offers some insights for developing games in today’s market. They are also planning to pull back the curtains for the world first reveal of their next big game! -- Panelists: Phil Larsen [CMO, Halfbrick]
Event.name: Halfbrick Studios Presents

Event.description: Despite the odd moment of brilliance - such as Bungie’s Marathon - gaming on the Mac has always been a bit of a joke. The second class citizen of the PC gaming world. But thanks to Steam, the Mac App Store, and developers writing for iOS - there’s been a resurgence lately. Will there ever be a solid gaming market on the Mac? Will there be a true Mac gaming rig? -- Panelists: Peter Wells [Editor and Community Manager, Mactalk], James Croft [Podcaster / Creator, Mactalk / Playwell Cup], Benny Ling [Writer, Mactalk], Raj Deut [Writer, Mactalk]
Event.name: Gaming on The Mac - Will There Ever Be A Rainbow?

Event.description: Immediately after Storytime with Ron Gilbert, stick around for a Q&A session featuring Gabe and Tycho of Penny Arcade! Two mics, one heck of a time! And please, no “who would win in a fight” questions. Also note that if you can’t make it to this panel, there’s another one on Sunday at 2:00pm in Main Theatre. These guys are givers. They give. -- Panelists: Gabe and Tycho!
Event.name: Penny Arcade Q & A

Event.description: The worlds of anime and gaming cross over in many ways. With similar cultural sources, common inspiration in character design, they are equally loved in pop culture. -- Panelists: There are similarities in storytelling, art and character design, and of course, direct adaptations both ways.
Event.name: Gaming and Anime: A Cultural Crossover

Event.description: RPG tabletop gaming is a constantly evolving past time, so come join our panel of gamers, actors, designers and developers to discuss where tabletop gaming is and where it can go. -- Panelists: Smartphones and tablet computers are becoming handy and powerful devices at the gaming table and the market is following with some great apps to enhance RPG games. From dice rollers to maps to soundscapes, there are many ways to enhance a session with technology.
Event.name: RPG Gaming - Beyond the Tabletop

Event.description: Getting a job in the games industry isn’t the only reason to do a games degree at university. Want to hear from people who study videogames without making them? This group of academic researchers will talk and answer questions about their experiences studying and researching videogames and gaming culture at postgraduate (PhD) level. Based on our different backgrounds and perspectives, we will explain the options for studying games in a range of disciplines; what entails researching them; our experience of academic life and what kind of careers can emerge from doing a research degree. This panel will discuss how game studies can be about more than good game design or programming, and explain the value of understanding how people play, understand and interact with games. You’ll learn why understanding the role and use of games in our contemporary culture and everyday lives can be more than about making ‘better’ games. -- Panelists: Join Marcus Carter, Mitchell Harrop, Brendan Keogh, Laura Crawford, Dale Leorke and Dan Golding for a discussion and Q&A about the importance of studying games for more reasons than just making them.
Event.name: We Study Games Without Having to Make Them: Musings from PhD research students

Event.description: Join Rooster Teeth Productions as they showcase some world premiere news! Watch a sneak peek of some brand new RWBY content and get caught up on various other shenanigans from the RT office. Panel members include Gus Sorola and some other people you probably don’t care about. -- Panelists: Burnie Burns [Rooster Teeth], Gus Sorola [Rooster Teeth], Jack Pattillo [Achievement Hunter, Rooster Teeth]
Event.name: Rooster Teeth

Event.description: D&D is a great way to get into tabletop role playing games, and for most of us, it was our first foray into that world. As classic and dear to us as it is, however, it has certain limitations. If all you have is a hammer, then suddenly everything starts to look like a nail. Role playing systems are no different. The system that handles a raucous dungeon crawl is probably not well tuned for a cyberpunk procedural or modern romantic comedy. -- Panelists: GeekNights has flown here all the way from New York, and we’d love for you to join us for a discussion of the role mechanics play in role playing games. They have more of an effect than you might realize. If D&D was your first venture, then we’re here to give you your next. Broaden your gaming horizons, flex your role-playing muscles, and learn what lies beyond.
Event.name: Beyond Dungeons & Dragons

Event.description: From the Australian masters of games and film animation, Plastic Wax, comes an incredible opportunity to go behind-the-scenes on some of the biggest games in the world. Plastic Wax will delve into making the photo-realistic cut-scenes and animations featured in Civilization V, Darksiders 2 as well as the upcoming title Neverwinter, plus, get their incredible contribution to the Saints Row series in a presentation that cannot be missed by gamers and fans of fine animation. -- Panelists: Matt Dignam [Studio Manager, Plastic Wax], Nathan Maddams [Creative Director, Plastic Wax]
Event.name: Thugs and Magicians: Deconstructing a Cut-scene with Plastic Wax

Event.description: Chiptune music is synonomous with videogames, with the golden era of gaming being soundtracked by its beeps and bloops. Join some Australian Chiptune musicians and promoters as they discuss the early age of Chiptune in the demo scene, the impact of events such as Blip Festival and the current trend of indie games having Chiptune soundtracks. -- Panelists: Chris Mylrae [cTrix, Syntax Demo Parties], Alex Yabsley [co-founder / Dot.AY, Square Sounds], Kristy Dossor [co-founder, Square Sounds / Soundbytes], Eugene Davoren-Britton [co-founder, Square Sounds / Soundbytes], Nathan Antony [Games Composer, Derris-Kharlan]
Event.name: Chiptunes: Past, Present and Future

Event.description: With more games being developed and released than ever before, and modern tech allowing far more flexibility than in the past - Is game development really pushing boundaries and going new places, or is it stagnating and paying too much homage to where it has already been? And when new, innovating gaming experiences are created, why do we hear so little about it? -- Panelists: Join a panel of games industry veterans from a variety of disciplines to answer these questions, and what gaming experiences the future is thus likely to hold in store.
Event.name: Games Can Be Anything - Are We Seeing Enough Innovation or Not, and Why?

Event.description: A look at the past and future of stealth gaming from the perspective of those who play stealth games and those who create stealth games. -- Panelists: Kristjan Zadziuk [Animation Director on Splinter Cell Blacklist, Ubisoft Toronto], Dan Hindes [Editor, PC PowerPlay & Sneaky Bastards], Nathan Cocks [Freelance Journalist, PC PowerPlay & Co-host, The Fourth Player Podcast], Terrence Jarrad [Freelance Journalist, PC PowerPlay], Dave Kozicki [Founder, rawDLC]
Event.name: Stealth Gaming feat. Splinter Cell Blacklist

Event.description: There’s a new generation of gamers on the way. Gamers whose parents are gamers too. Gamers whose parents ‘get it’. But as one of those parents, what’s the best way to raise a new gamer from scratch? -- Panelists: Our panel searches for the place between non-stop gaming and strictly controlled access for the best way to raise a well-adjusted, well-rounded next generation gamer.
Event.name: Gamers TNG: Breeding The Next Generation

Event.description: Join four intrepid BioWare staffers as they make the long trek from Edmonton Alberta Canada to talk with their fans in Melbourne, Australia. Meet Cameron Lee (Producer), Patrick Weekes (Senior Writer), Karin Weekes (Lead Editor) and “Evil” Chris Priestly (Community Team) as they discuss Dragon Age & Mass Effect, what it is like living in snowy Edmonton (they had the coldest winter since 1896 this year) and answer your questions during BioWare’s first ever panel in Australia! -- Panelists: Chris ‘Evil’ Priestly [Community Specialist, BioWare], Cameron Lee [Producer, BioWare], Patrick Weekes [Senior Writer, BioWare], Karin Week [Lead Editor, BioWare]
Event.name: BioWare Journeys Down Under

Event.description: Killer Instinct is one of the most beloved fighting game franchises in history and the series features a strong musical legacy. Microsoft have recently announced the return of Killer Instinct for Xbox One and the musical responsibilities have fallen upon the shoulders of Australian video game composer, Mick Gordon. Join Mick at PAX Aus for a behind-the-scenes preview of how the music for Killer Instinct is being written and produced, ask questions about a game audio career and be part of a crowd sourced audio that will be used in the final game! -- Panelists: Mick Gordon [Composer]
Event.name: Killer Instinct: Behind the Music

Event.description: For the first time, the Xbox One will be shown in Australia. Join Microsoft as they share their vision and show more about how the Xbox One will shape the future of gaming.
Event.name: Microsoft Presents: Xbox One
Omegathon Round 2 - Win, Lose, or Draw

Event.description: Playing games is one thing, but what about raising the kids who play the games? Kristin and Ben from the Penny Arcade Report are joined with Eric from Microsoft to talk about raising kids in a gaming household, and the fun / terror that often ensues. -- Panelists: Ben Kuchera [Penny Arcade], Kristin Lindsay [Penny Arcade], Eric Neustadter [Microsoft]
Event.name: Penny Arcade Report - On Parenting

Event.description: The first release from IRL Shooter, a live action video game production company, Patient 0, is set in a building overun with zombies with teams fighting for survival. Along the way players need to collect information, decipher puzzles, kill zombies and try to not get killed. The first game commenced Halloween 2012 in Melbourne after it broke the record for a crowd funded project in Australia in 2012, originally setting out to raise A$10,000 the final tally was $243,480, plus additional tickets sales after the funding goal was met. Bringing together gameplay, atmosphere, high tech IR rifles, zombies and a cast of over 150 actors was no easy feat. David Leadbetter, Drew Hobbs, Zoe Tame and Leigh Klaver will discuss how the project got off the ground, what challenges they faced and how they are developing the game based on the lessons they learned along the way. -- Panelists: Leigh Klaver [IRL Shooter], Zoe Tame [IRL Shooter], Drew Hobbs [IRL Shooter], David Leadbetter [IRL Shooter], Steven Conway [Swinburne University of Tech]
Event.name: IRL Shooter: Patient-0 & the Future of Live Action Video Gaming

Event.description: The AIS is a showcase of independent games to be exhibited at PAX Australia. Our group of industry experts have culled a selection of games into what they collectively feel are the six best games in regards to gameplay and overall fun-factor. Join the creators of those games LIVE and on stage! Questions will be asked! Answers may appear! And you will get a chance to talk to these up and coming indie game superstars. -- Panelists: Jeff Kalles [Penny Arcade]
Event.name: Aussie Indie Showcase

Event.description: Our first night of concerts, you may feast upon the sounds of Melbourne based chiptunes artists from SoundBytes, and the godfather of nerdcore himself - MC Frontalot
Event.name: Friday Night Concerts

Event.description: IGN Australia’s hugely popular Pubcast podcast, live for the first time! Come and hang out with the IGN AU crew, as we talk shit about games, films and, erm, dolphin sex. -- Panelists: Cam Shea [Senior Editor, IGN], Tristan Ogilvie [Video Editor, IGN], Luke Reilly [Games Editor, IGN], Lucy O’Brien [Assistant Editor, IGN], Jem Gold [Freelancer, Freelancer], Ben Baker [Freelancer, Freelancer]
Event.name: IGN AU Pubcast Live!

Event.description: During the 16 bit era one TV show provided the gamers with the latest and greatest in video gaming news. That show was “The Zone”. Presented by Adam Reilly, Muttlee and a host of magazine reviewers from Nintendo Magazine System, Gamestar and Hyper, this underappreciated show is bought to you by Beyond Media and Retrospekt. Check out 3 episodes showcasing the latest in Super Nintendo, Megadrive and PC gaming from the mid 90s. -- Panelists: Paul Monopoli [Presenter, Retrospekt]
Event.name: Screening - The Zone

Event.description: The Story of Mojang is a feature-length documentary that follows the young company over the course of its first year as their profile expanded across the world stage and into the homes of millions of gamers. Featuring insights from industry icons (Peter Molyneux, Tim Schafer), journalists (Geoff Keighley, Stephen Totilo), tastemakers (Gabe & Tycho of Penny Arcade), and players profoundly impacted by the game (Yogscast, The Shaft, Minecraft Teacher), the film serves as a time capsule for one of this generation’s most unorthodox success stories.
Event.name: Screening - Minecraft: The Story of Mojang
